Armada

Armada is an application to achieve high throughput of run-to-completion jobs on multiple Kubernetes clusters.

It stores queues for users/projects with pod specifications and creates these pods once there is available resource in one of the connected Kubernetes clusters.




Learn more

Key features

Learn more about how Armada can help you scale

Resource Light

Armada maintains fair resource share over time (inspired by HTCondor priority)

More about us
High Throughput

Armada can handle large amounts of queued jobs (million+)

Learn about our products
Uninterrupted

Armada allows adding and removing clusters from the system without disruption

Check our documentation
Massive Scale

By utilizing multiple Kubernetes clusters, the system can scale beyond the limits of a single Kubernetes cluster

Check our documentation

Key Concepts

Learn more about how Armada works

Queue

Represents a user or project, used to maintain fair share over time, with a priority factor

Learn more
Job

Unit of work to be run (described as a Kubernetes PodSpec)

Learn more
Job Set

Group of related jobs. The API allows observing progress of a job set together

Learn more


Try it out locally

Follow the quickstart guide to get Armada up and running locally.
